product_description.product_name: ViroDecs™ Ready-mix concrete Victoria - ECOPact Range
product_description.description: Concrete prepared by mixing cement, coarse and fine aggregates, water, with or without auxiliary agents and additives. Placed on building site or prefabricated in factory moulds, compacted and hardened by hydration of cement.

classes.normal_class: Designed for residential applications, low rise buildings, paving and driveways. Specification and ordering simplified.
classes.special_class: Allows purchaser to specify special requirements such as high-strength, high durability, marine application, post-tensioned, high-pumpability, super workable, piling concrete, architectural finishes and decorative applications.

product_description.strength_range_mpa: Various mixes from approximately 20 MPa to 82 MPa
product_description.mix_codes_and_descriptions: Detailed list of mix codes with strength and description provided in the document (e.g. BE324XN: 82MPa 14mm NEPEAN EXPOSED ECOPact CONC, VE401EVMW: S40 10mm VR400 650 SPREAD ECOPact CONC, etc.)
product_description.dangerous_goods_classification: Non-Dangerous Goods according to Australian Code for the Transport of Dangerous Goods by Road and Rail
product_description.packaging: Delivered in bulk with no packaging

lca_information.reference_service_life: Not specified (scope is cradle to gate)
databases_and_software: Australian National Life Cycle Inventory Database (AusLCI) (2018)
Global Cement and Concrete (GCCA) EPD Tool Project Database version 3.1 (International Version) (2021)
Product specific EPDs for pigments and fibres
lca_information.allocation: Physical allocation based on weight or m³ of concrete; economic allocation used when physical allocation not possible; fly ash and silica fumes assumed waste and burden-free; ground granulated blast furnace slag allocated economically.
lca_information.cut_off_criteria: No flows excluded based on cut-off criteria
lca_information.data_quality: Foreground data assessed medium or higher for geographic and temporal representativeness; background data updated within 10 years as required by PCR 2019:14 v1.11
lca_information.system_boundaries: Cradle to gate; excludes use stage, end of life stage, benefits and loads outside system boundary; excludes environmental impacts relating to personnel, infrastructure and production equipment not directly consumed in process

transport_and_installation.transport: Includes transport by transoceanic freight ship, rigid truck and/or domestic freight ship; on-site transport included

end_of_life.description: Not included in LCA; four scenarios per BS EN 16757:2017: 1) Disposal at landfill, 2) Reuse in new construction, 3) Use in land restoration, 4) Crushing/recycling (substitution of primary material or natural aggregates). Scenarios 2-4 can result in benefits and loads outside system boundary and should be considered in whole-of-life studies.

carbon_emission_context.global_warming_potential: Provided per mix in kg CO2 equivalents per m³
carbon_emission_context.carbonation: Natural process of CO2 absorption by concrete after use stage; not considered in this EPD and not reflected in results tables
carbon_emission_context.offsets: CO2 emitted during cement manufacturing can be partly offset by lifetime absorption of CO2

recycled_materials_handling.fly_ash: Treated as waste material, burden-free except transport impacts
recycled_materials_handling.silica_fume: Treated as waste material, burden-free except transport impacts
recycled_materials_handling.ground_granulated_blast_furnace_slag: Allocated economically due to significant economic value
recycled_materials_handling.allocation_approach: AusLCI LCA database allocation approach adopted for secondary data and processes

references: Australian Life Cycle Inventory Database Initiative (AusLCI) (2018)
Man Yu et al. (2017) The Carbon Footprint of Australia’s Construction Sector
